DOC.brief_summary: To demonstrate equivalence patency performance GORE-TEX PROPATEN Vascular Grafts Thin Walled GORE-TEX Stretch Vascular Grafts peripheral bypass application support claim substantial equivalence .
DOC.criteria: Patient require primary aboveknee bypass proximal anastomosis common femoral proximal superficial femoral artery distal anastomosis popliteal artery proximal medial head gastrocnemius ; Patient Grade III IV occlusive vascular disease ; Patient postoperative life expectancy great one year ; Patient least 21 year age ; Patient able comply study requirement available followup visit 1 month , 6 month 12 month post procedure ; Patient willing able provide write , informed consent . Patient previous bypass diseased extremity ( iliacs ) ; Patient know coagulation disorder include hypercoagulability ; Patient previous instance Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia type 2 ( HIT2 ) know hypersensitivity heparin ; Patient acute embolic arterial occlusion ; Patient require sequential extremity revascularizations procedure require use additional vascular graft ; Patient percutaneous transluminal angioplasty implant site within previous 30 day ; Patient need , schedule , cardiac surgical procedure different vascular surgical procedure ; Patient active infection region graft placement ; Patient incomplete preoperative assessment ( outline protocol ) due emergency procedure , traumatic injury reason .
